info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 01 at 2:05PM PDT until August 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Lightning activity will increase across the region towards the end of the week... .Monsoon moisture and an upper level low will kick off thunderstorm activity in the region on Thursday. Storms have a higher potential of being dry on Thursday. Storm activity has a moderate chance of continuing into Thursday night. More thunderstorm activity is anticipated Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 624 AND 625... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Some of the thunderstorms have the potential of being dry. Any fires that develop under dry storms will likely spread rapidly. Abundant lightning under wetter storms can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources in the zones listed below. * AFFECTED AREA...In ORZ624...The eastern sections of fire weather zone 624. In ORZ625... the entire zone of fire weather zone 625. * THUNDERSTORMS...Storms have a higher potential of being dry on Thursday. Storm are anticipated to cover more area and produce more lightning on Friday. The probability of lightning within 25 miles of any point in the watch area is roughly 50 percent Friday. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 40 mph. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.
